task.title: Migrate an Image from AWS to Eucalyptus
task.shortdesc: To migrate an image from AWS to Eucalyptus, perform the following steps.

info.codeblock: euca-describe-images --region aws IMAGE ami-a6e15bcf aws-marketplace/CentOS-6.3-x86_64-GA-ebs-85586466-5b6c-4495-b580-14f72b4bcf51-ami-3689325f.1 aws-marketplace available privatex86_64 machine aki-88aa75e1 ebs paravirtual xen BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING /dev/sda snap-831129f5 8 false

step.cmd: Run an instance from the image you chose.
SSH into the instance and verify that the instance is valid for use with Eucalyptus.

substep.cmd: Make sure --check-dependencies exits with 0 if all dependencies necessary for the executable's operation are present and 1 otherwise

Make sure that a path to a mounted Linux image exits with 1 if the check could be invoked and did not pass (if check passed, or could not be invoked, or the image is not a Linux image, the validator is to exit with 0)
Make sure that all parameters are passed via command-line arguments, not environment variables
Make sure that all input paths/files and output paths/files are specified as parameters (that is, there are no unspecified files or directories left after the validator exits)
Check /etc/fstab and remove any non-standard drives or partitions (input: block-device mapping) and any reference to Xen device names
Make sure that the acpiphp module is available
Make sure that udev net persistent
ensure special system directories are not populated (places like proc, sysfs, devpts, debugfs, udevfs, cgroup, tmpfs, etc., which should not have real files in them)
ensure that not more than one Ethernet device is configured

step.cmd: Mount a volume that is at least 1.5 times as large as the entire instance.
Switch the Euca2ools configuration file to use Eucalyptus
Upload the AWS bundled instance to Eucalyptus.
